docs.snippet: The Colts owner Jim Irsay was suspended and fined $500,000 by the N.F.L. on after he pleaded guilty Tuesday to a misdemeanor related to a March traffic stop....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Colts owner Jim Irsay was suspended and fined $500,000 by the N.F.L. on after he pleaded guilty Tuesday to a misdemeanor related to a March traffic stop.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; commissioner Roger Goodell suspends Indianapolis Colts owner Jim Irsay for six games and fines him $500,000 for violating league’s personal conduct policy; Irsay was arrested on the suspicion of being intoxicated while driving near his home; other football news noted.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Bars Jim Irsay for 6 Games for D.W.I. Incident
headline.main: Colts’ Owner Is Suspended and Fined After a Guilty Plea
headline.print_headline: Colts’ Owner Is Suspended and Fined After Guilty Plea

docs.snippet: Why the market for pollsters, strategists and other political experts doesn’t work....
docs.lead_paragraph: Why the market for pollsters, strategists and other political experts doesn’t work.

headline.main: You Lose, We Win: Consultants Profit Even When Candidates Underperform

docs.snippet: Miles Kirkland, 16, a junior at Curtis High School, had been practicing in the heat Monday morning; the medical examiner is working to determine the cause of death....
docs.lead_paragraph: Miles Kirkland, 16, a junior at Curtis High School, had been practicing in the heat Monday morning; the medical examiner is working to determine the cause of death.
docs.abstract: Teammates of Miles Kirkland, 16-year-old Staten Island student who collapsed and died during football practice at Curtis High School, express shock and grief; initial autopsy is inconclusive; teammates say the weather was hot and humid, but that Kirkland was in excellent shape.

headline.main: Grief at Staten Island School After Football Player Collapses and Dies
headline.print_headline: Grief at High School After a Football Player Collapses and Dies

docs.snippet: Pat Narduzzi will have enough to worry about when Michigan State takes on Oregon this weekend, so the talkative defensive coordinator dismissed the idea that jet lag or the heat might play a significant role in the outcome....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pat Narduzzi will have enough to worry about when Michigan State takes on Oregon this weekend, so the talkative defensive coordinator dismissed the idea that jet lag or the heat might play a significant role in the outcome.

headline.main: Narduzzi Preparing for Huge Test Against Oregon
headline.print_headline: Narduzzi Preparing for Huge Test Against Oregon

docs.snippet: The structure has become a favored spot for drug deals and neighborhood drama, angering locals who have been trying for years to get it removed....
docs.lead_paragraph: The structure has become a favored spot for drug deals and neighborhood drama, angering locals who have been trying for years to get it removed.
docs.abstract: Harlem residents call for scaffolding at corner of Lenox Avenue and 123rd Street to be removed, as structure enters second decade since erected; sidewalk shed is used as a place to urinate, have occasional outdoor sex and indulge in drug deals; Mayor Bill de Blasio has promised to remove unneeded scaffolding around city-owned buildings but private housing residents seek similar relief.

headline.main: 10 Years On, Scaffolding in Harlem Is Still a Shelter for Noxious Acts
headline.print_headline: 10 Years On, Still a Shelter for Noxious Acts
